content.description: Sit start the right trending arête and top out.
content.location: On the backside of the second DNA boulder. Locate the cool looking right trending arête that faces the Lower Primate Wall.

content.description:
The obvious well featured line of wrinkled seams on the right side of the face. Stand start on good holds then move through a crimpy crux to gain a high jug. Grab a nice right hand pinch block then swing a foot onto the lip out left and top out.

 It is likely this line has been done before because it is so obvious and the holds were clean. I did have to clean the lip to the left which was covered in moss. I will change the name/FA if anyone else reports they did it.
content.location: The rightmost line on the steep headwall of the second DNA boulder.

content.description:
Code of Life shares the start of Aging Backwards but instead of moving left toward the jug rail this problem goes directly up the center of the face then traverses right on the slopey lip and tops out as for Only Getting Younger. I thought it was just as good as its neighbor and slightly harder.

 From the starting shelf grab a right hand tooth crimp then hit a left hand gaston. Match the crimpy seam above then hit the slopey but very textured lip. Traverse the lip right a bit and top out.
content.location: Directly up the center of the steep face on the second DNA boulder.

content.description: Problem starts from the lowest sit start possible (right hand low on arête below the rock that leans against the arête) and moves up the arête and tops out.
content.location: The far right steep arête on the first DNA boulder you reach which faces the climber's trail.

content.description: Sit start the steep headwall using a slopey shelf with a decent knob. Move left to a crimp and the right hand to a high, small crimpy sidepull and then launch left to match on an edge and the traverse all the way left to the same top out as the problem The Pearl.
content.location: The steep headwall on the second DNA boulder that faces the Lower Primate Wall.

pathTokens: 1. Kinsman Notch East (aka The Monkey Cliffs) Climbing &

content.description: Several large blocks next to each other with three current problems.
